Authors:
Fang Wu, Jia-Jia Chen, Bao-Kai Cui, Yu Cheng Dai, Yuan
Yuan
Title:
Terrestriporiaceae fam. nov., a new family of Russulales
(Basidiomycota)
Abstract:
A new family of Russulales, Terrestriporiaceae fam. nov.,
is proposed based on the combination of molecular data and morphological
evidences, and it is typified by Terrestriporia gen. nov. The
phylogenetic analyses show that Terrestriporia alba sp. nov. forms a
monophyletic lineage within Russulales. The new family is characterized
by annual and resupinate basidiomata, poroid hymenophore, a monomitic
hyphal structure, and generative hyphae mostly simple septate, but
occasionally having clamp connections, the presence of gloeoplerous
hyphae and cystidioles, thin-walled, hyaline, smooth, amyloid and
acyanophilous basidiospores. So far Terrestriporia alba is found from
Malaysia, tropical Asia.
